answers.answer:
Refugees in Romania can access support services including various help-lines for general information, rights, and specific issues like anti-trafficking or domestic violence, as well as medical support, children support, and assistance with accommodation requests.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/call-center, where you can find a comprehensive list of help-lines and specific contact information for each service.

Yes, there is dedicated support and counseling for children provided by Save the Children, including a telephone line for counseling and a line for guidance and information on the protection of children coming from Ukraine.

To find this information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center` and look under the section titled "Children support".

answers.answer:
One can find information about accommodation requests and conditions of stay in Romania by contacting the General Inspectorate for Immigration (Bucharest Directorate of Immigration) at 0214109940.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and look under the "Help-lines" section, specifically for the "Support for accommodation requests and information regarding the conditions of stay on the Romanian territory" entry.

answers.answer:
Some help-lines have specific operating hours, such as the Romanian Government help-line and Save the Children's guidance line, which operate during weekdays. The Migration and Asylum Office in the Republic of Moldova is explicitly listed as 24/7, while most other help-lines do not have their operating hours specified.

To find detailed information, visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center` and read the descriptions next to each help-line number under the "Help-lines" section.

Yes, there are local help-lines specific to cities within Romania, including Sibiu and Timișoara. For Sibiu, you can contact the Sibiu City Hall’s TelVerde, and for Timișoara, there's the Call center Timișoara City Hall.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and look under the section "Help-lines from cities throughout Romania".
